name: Solitaire: Tactics
description:
"It's solitaire, how hard can it be?" you wonder. 

The more you try, the more you'll dislike the answer.

You start with a single deck, aces removed. Your goal is to sort each kind in their rows, e.g. one row diamonds from 2 to K, another clubs 2 to K etc. 

You do that by putting the appropriate cards into the empty slots; appropriate being the one following the left of the empty slot, e.g. if there's 5-Spade and an empty space on the right of it, you only can put 6-Spade on the empty space. 

If you get stuck (i.e. no more moves possible), you'll have two chances to shuffle the unsorted cards; sorted cards stay where they are.
